title: Research study shows consuming almonds daily can lower diabetes and BP, see details
summary: Research reveals that daily almond consumption can help reduce blood sugar levels and blood pressure without causing weight gain. The study particularly shows benefits for Asian Indians, with almonds helping to lower LDL cholesterol and diastolic blood pressure. Experts recommend taking a divided portion morning and evening.
content:
Almost every person adds almonds in their daily diet. Almonds are great source of plant protein, good fat and fibre. It's a healthy-heart diet. But, there have been worries about whether having these nutrients consistently could lead to weight gain and calorie spike. A research has shown that consuming Almonds can help in reducing blood sugar levels and BP.

According to a research, it showed that almond consumption does not result in weight gain but results in small reductions of LDL (low-density liproprotein) or bad cholesterol. It also helps in lowering diastolic blood pressure (the pressure in your arteries when your heart rests between beats or the bottom number in a blood pressure reading).

A study also showed that consuming almonds helps in reducing blood sugar in certain populations. Especially in Asian Indians.

Almonds is a super food which can act as a beneficiary dietary tool. Dr. Anup Misra, chairman, Fortis C-Doc for diabetes and endocrinology said, "Our previous studies have shown how pre-loading our meals with almonds cuts blood sugar. Now this scientific paper demonstrates benefits for cardio metabolic health."

Take a fistful of almonds divide in half every morning and evening. For people with diabetes, almonds are a great snack in between meals or 30 minutes before meals. Make sure to not exceed daily recommended calorie intake.

## Health Benefits of Almonds

Almost every person adds almonds in their daily diet. Almonds are great source of plant protein, good fat and fibre. It's a healthy-heart diet. But, there have been worries about whether having these nutrients consistently could lead to weight gain and calorie spike. A research has shown that consuming Almonds can help in reducing blood sugar levels and BP.

## Research Findings

According to a research, it showed that almond consumption does not result in weight gain but results in small reductions of LDL (low-density liproprotein) or bad cholesterol. It also helps in lowering diastolic blood pressure (the pressure in your arteries when your heart rests between beats or the bottom number in a blood pressure reading).

A study also showed that consuming almonds helps in reducing blood sugar in certain populations. Especially in Asian Indians.

## Expert Opinion

Almonds is a super food which can act as a beneficiary dietary tool. 

> "Our previous studies have shown how pre-loading our meals with almonds cuts blood sugar. Now this scientific paper demonstrates benefits for cardio metabolic health." - Dr. Anup Misra, chairman, Fortis C-Doc for diabetes and endocrinology

## Consumption Guidelines

* Take a fistful of almonds divide in half every morning and evening
* For people with diabetes, almonds are a great snack in between meals or 30 minutes before meals
* Make sure to not exceed daily recommended calorie intake
